intent_atoms.description: ParseIssueStore must provide metricsSnapshot() and makeIssueSummary() to allow SwiftUI ribbons and CLI flows to fetch per-severity counts, totals, and deepest affected depth without recomputing the store.
As a user of the SwiftUI UI or CLI ribbon, I want to see aggregated parse issue metrics so that I can quickly assess severity distribution and overall health.

The system must expose metricsSnapshot() and makeIssueSummary() APIs in ParseIssueStore; these APIs should return per-severity counts, total counts, and deepest affected depth. The UI and CLI ribbons must be able to consume these values without recomputing the store.
Documentation for tolerant parsing must reference the new aggregation APIs (DOCS/AI/Tolerance_Parsing/TODO.md, IntegrationSummary.md).
ParseIssueStoreTests must cover severity dictionaries, background snapshots, and summary DTOs to validate correct behavior.
The ParseIssueStore will be extended with metricsSnapshot() and makeIssueSummary() methods; these are added as part of the store's public API for aggregation purposes.
